description: Electronic Clerk's Notes for proceedings held before Chief Judge F. Dennis Saylor, IV: Case called; Arguments on pending motions heard; Supplemental Briefs to be filed Regarding D. 630 Motion in Limine #4. Final Pretrial Conference to remain set for 1/4/24.ORDERS ON MOTIONS:Court DENIED 620 MOTION in Limine NO. 5 RE: GOOGLE PATENTS as stated on the record.Court DENIED 621 MOTION in Limine NO. 6: TO PRECLUDE EVIDENCE, TESTIMONY, OR ARGUMENT CONSISTING OF AD HOMINEM ATTACKS OR PEJORATIVE OR MISLEADING LABELS FOR SINGULAR, ITS BUSINESS, ITS PATENTS, OR THIS LAWSUIT as stated on the record. Court DENIED without prejudice 622 MOTION in Limine NO. 7 TO PRECLUDE DEFENDANT FROM OFFERING EVIDENCE OR ARGUMENT CONCERNING ALTERNATIVE CHIPS USING THE NUMBER FORMAT FP16 as stated on the record.Court DENIED 624 MOTION in Limine NO. 8 RE: EVALUATION AGREEMENTS PRODUCED BY SINGULAR as stated on the record.Court DENIED 626 MOTION in Limine NO. 9: TO PRECLUDE EVIDENCE, TESTIMONY, OR ARGUMENT THAT MEMBERS OF THE INDUSTRY USE GRAPHICS PROCESSOR UNITS FOR ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE TRAINING APPLICATIONS as stated on the record.ORDERS ON D. 630 MOTION in Limine [Omnibus]:Court DENIED Motion in Limine #1 as stated on the record. Court DENIED without prejudice Motion in Limine #2 as stated on the record.Court GRANTED IN PART AND DENIED IN PART Motion in Limine #3 as stated on the record. Court GRANTED IN PART AND DENIED IN PART Motion in Limine #5 as stated on the record. Court GRANTED Motion in Limine #6 as stated on the record.Court GRANTED Motion in Limine #7 as stated on the record. COURT GRANTED IN PART AND DENIED IN PART Motion in Limine #8 as stated on the record.COURT GRANTED IN PART AND DENIED IN PART Motion in Limine #9 as stated on the record.COURT GRANTED IN PART AND DENIED IN PART Motion in Limine #10 as stated on the record.COURT GRANTED IN PART AND DENIED IN PART Motion in Limine #11 as stated on the record. COURT GRANTED Motion in Limine #12 as stated on the record.COURT GRANTED Motion in Limine #13 as stated on the record.COURT GRANTED without prejudice Motion in Limine #14 as stated on the record.PENDING MOTIONS:D. 619 MOTION in Limine NO. 4: TO PRECLUDE GOOGLE FROM ARGUING INVALIDITY BASED ON VFLOAT, ALONE OR IN COMBINATION WITH OTHER REFERENCES.D. 628 MOTION in Limine NO. 10 RE: UNTIMELY SECTION 287 DAMAGES ARGUMENT.D. 630 Motion in Limine MOTION in Limine [Omnibus] #4. (Court Reporter: Valerie OHara at vaohara@gmail.com.)(Attorneys present: Adam R. Doherty, Kerry L. Timbers, Robert Gilman, Jeffrey Pyle and Brian M. Seeve for the plaintiff. Robert A. Van Nest, Vishesh Narayen, Matthias A. Kamber, Rachael E. Meny, Anna Porto, Eric Phung, Nathan Speed and Deeva Shah for the defendant.) (McKillop, Matthew) (Entered: 12/22/2023)
